Package com.duocardgame

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.duocardgame.Player
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the card game. A player has a name, a hand of cards, and a score. The class provides functionality for managing the player's hand, score, and making game decisions.

    Constructs a new Player with the given name.

    • choosePlayableCard

      public Card choosePlayableCard(Card topCard)
      Chooses a playable card from the player's hand based on the top card of the discard pile. The method categorizes playable cards into same-color cards, different-colored cards, and wild cards. It then prioritizes the choice based on card color match and score.
      Parameters:
      topCard - the card on the top of the discard pile
      Returns:
      a playable card if one exists; otherwise, null

    • chooseColor

      public CardColor chooseColor()
      Chooses a color for a wild card based on the composition of the player's hand. The method counts the non-WILD cards in the player's hand and selects the color with the highest count. In the event of a tie or if no non-WILD cards are present, a random non-WILD color is chosen.
      Returns:
      the chosen CardColor for the wild card

    • playCard

      public Card playCard(Card card)
      Plays the specified card by removing it from the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to play
      Returns:
      the card that was played

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player, including the player's name and hand.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the player
